doc.after: On August 9, 1904, Cross and Harris found gold on the south side of a southwestern Nevada hill later called Bullfrog Mountain.[25] Assays of ore samples from the site suggested values up to $3,000 a ton,[26] or about $79,000 a ton in 2015 dollars when adjusted for inflation.[27] Word of the discovery spread to Tonopah and beyond, and soon thousands of hopeful prospectors and speculators rushed to what became known as the Bullfrog Mining District.[28]
